response.overview: This documentary chronicles a journalistic investigation that reveals, through testimonies, the complete circuit of death flights carried out during the last Argentine military dictatorship.  From there, it exposes, through previously unpublished documentation, the clandestine graves in the General Lavalle cemetery, where the bodies found on the beaches of Buenos Aires province from the "flights" were buried. The bodies of Azucena Villaflor, Esther Ballestrino de Careaga, and María Ponce, founders of the Mothers of Plaza de Mayo who were disappeared by the ESMA task forces, were found in these graves.
response.title: Historias de aparecidos
